hotspots.label: Shell Fossil
hotspots.fact: This is a fossilized shell imprint preserved in rock for millions of years! Fossils help scientists learn about ancient creatures that lived long ago.

hotspots.label: Sedimentary Rock
hotspots.fact: This rock formed from layers of sand and sediment that were pressed together over time. Sedimentary rocks often contain fossils because organisms get buried in these layers.

hotspots.label: Fossil Details
hotspots.fact: You can see the detailed ridges and patterns on this shell fossil! These details tell us what kind of sea creature lived here millions of years ago.

hotspots.label: Rock Weathering
hotspots.fact: The cracks and pits on the rock surface show weathering from wind and water. Over time, rocks slowly break down into smaller pieces like sand.
